Bread for the poor, or, A method shewing how the poor may be maintained and duly provided for in a far more plentiful and yet cheaper manner than now they are without waste or want. R. D. (Richard Dunning)
[3], 28 p.
Printed by Samuel Darker for Charles Yeo, John Pearce and Philip Bishop, Exeter [Devon] : 1698.
"Epistle dedicatory" signed: R.D. Reproduction of original in the British Library.
=======

[3], 28 p.
Printed by Samuel Darker for Charles Yeo, John Pearce and Philip Bishop, Exeter [Devon] : 1698.
